meta.content: Supporting Families During COVID-19 | Child Mind Institute

The Child Mind Institute is open and available for you and your child during this crisis. Our expert clinicians can do telehealth evaluations and treatment for ADHD, mood disorders, anxiety disorders, autism spectrum disorders and learning disorders. Click here to request a remote appointment and learn more. Our supportive resources include: Facebook Live video chats with …

div.p: It takes a community of friends, supporters and advocates to transform children’s lives. We need your help and invite you to take action with us! Start now.

div.h1:
Hacer frente durante el
COVID-19: lea nuestros recursos en español

div.p: The Child Mind Institute, Inc., is a 501(c)(3) organization. Make a one-time gift or a monthly sustaining gift. Your contributions are fully tax-deductible.
We know parents are struggling to balance work, child care and self-care while keeping worries — both your children’s and your own — under control. You don’t have to do it alone.

The Child Mind Institute is open and available for you and your child during this crisis. Our expert clinicians can do telehealth evaluations and treatment for ADHD, mood disorders, anxiety disorders, autism spectrum disorders and learning disorders. Click here to request a remote appointment and learn more.
Our supportive resources include:

li.a: Facebook Live video chats with expert clinicians (10am and 4.30pm)
Phone consultations for follow-up about Facebook Live events and other questions about the best way to manage kids at home
Daily tips for parenting during the crisis, via email

li.strong: Comprehensive resources for parents on coronavirus topics below the video

p.strong: And Today’s Daily Tip: FIND JOY

iframe.title: How To Find Joy During The Coronavirus Pandemic

p.a: Click here for a playlist of previous Daily Tips.

p.strong: Click below to navigate to each section:

p.a: Supporting Kids Through the COVID-19 Crisis
p.br: Tips for nurturing and protecting children at home.

p.a: Supporting Teenagers and Young Adults During the Coronavirus Crisis
p.br: Tips for parents with older children at home.

p.a: Self-Care in the Time of Coronavirus
p.br: For parents, prioritizing your own well-being benefits your whole family.

p.a: Anxiety and Coping With the Coronavirus
p.br: Managing worry — your kids’ and your own.

p.a: How Mindfulness Can Help During COVID-19
p.br: Tips for calming anxiety during a difficult time.

p.a: Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus
p.br: Kids worry more when they’re kept in the dark. Here’s what to say.

p.a: Giving Kids With ADHD Support and Structure During the Coronavirus Crisis
p.br: Managing attention (yours and theirs) will help kids thrive.

p.a: Single Parenting During the Coronavirus Crisis
p.br: Strategies for managing when you’re going it alone

p.a: Coronavirus Parenting: Managing Anger and Frustration
p.br: Parents everywhere are losing their temper and yelling at their kids. How to maintain your cool under stress

p.a: Resources for Families of Children on the Spectrum
p.br: From how to talk to kids with autism about the coronavirus to how to teach handwashing and develop schedules.
Clinicians from our Learning and Development Center have organized resources for parents who are suddenly responsible for the home school environment.
Anxiety in children sometimes manifest physically. Here’s what to watch for.

p.a: How to Help Children Manage Fears
p.br: Tips for teaching children how to build resilience and learn to calm themselves down, even when things feel scary.
Go-to techniques for coaxing anxiety-prone children out of their fears from a Mom who’s been there.

p.a: How to Avoid Passing Anxiety on to Your Kids
p.br: Help yourself, and them, by learning techniques to manage stress in a healthy way.

p.a: How Anxiety Leads to Disruptive Behavior
p.br: Kids who are acting out, melting down, or being defiant may actually be seriously anxious.

p.a: What to Do (and Not Do) When Children Are Anxious
p.br: How to respect their feelings without empowering their fears.

p.a: Panic Attacks and How to Treat Them
p.br: Knowing what to look for and how to help children calm down is key.
How a meditation practice can help kids (and parents) feel less anxious and more relaxed.

p.a: Why Do Kids Have Problems With Transitions?
p.br: A look at why being asked to switch gears is a common trigger for whining and tantrums.

p.a: How Can We Help Kids With Transitions?
p.br: With the right support, children can learn to change gears without whining and tantrums.
And tips for avoiding them.

p.a: Why do Kids Have Tantrums and Meltdowns?
p.br: Understanding why they happen can help parents head problems off before they escalate.
Setting and enforcing consistent limits is key.

p.a: How To Make Time Outs Work
p.br: Tips for using them effectively.
How parents can keep the peace and help kids learn to resolve conflicts.

p.a: Coronavirus Parenting: Managing Anger and Frustration
p.br: Parents everywhere are losing their temper and yelling at their kids. How to maintain your cool under stress
Tips broken down into a range of ages and experiences, and information about what to say, who should say it, what to look out for and how to help.

p.a: How to Handle Holidays After a Death in the Family
p.br: Grief can make special days harder
The disorder looks different in children as they develop
There are several evidence-based therapies for young people with PTSD

div.p: Get the latest news and resources in your inbox.

is_redirect && ! is_confirmation;var mt = parseInt(jQuery('html').css('margin-top'), 10) + parseInt(jQuery('body').css('margin-top'), 10) + 100;if(is_form){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_38').html(form_content.html());if(form_content.hasClass('gform_validation_error')){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_38').addClass('gform_validation_error');} else {jQuery('#gform_wrapper_38').removeClass('gform_validation_error');}setTimeout( function() { /* delay the scroll by 50 milliseconds to fix a bug in chrome */ }, 50 );if(window['gformInitDatepicker']) {gformInitDatepicker();}if(window['gformInitPriceFields']) {gformInitPriceFields();}var current_page = jQuery('#gform_source_page_number_38').val();gformInitSpinner( 38, 'https://childmind.org/wp-content/themes/childmind/assets/img/rolling.svg' );jQuery(document).trigger('gform_page_loaded', [38, current_page]);window['gf_submitting_38'] = false;}else if(!is_redirect){var confirmation_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('.GF_AJAX_POSTBACK').html();if(!confirmation_content){confirmation_content = contents;}setTimeout(function(){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_38').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [38]);window['gf_submitting_38'] = false;}, 50);}else{jQuery('#gform_38').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger('gform_post_render', [38, current_page]);} );} );
